_source.text: [1] Although the Michelin guide is no worse an offender than Zagat as a distant judge of our restaurants - its offices are farther away, but only because the guide is French and cannot be blamed for the relative remoteness of France - there is nonetheless something galling about the colonialism of outsiders' kiting in to assess us, then trumpeting their findings to the rest of the country and world as authority.
